intro: Gonzalagunia bunchosioides, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright red bracts that resemble flames. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sunlight. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered within the vibrant bracts. Gonzalagunia bunchosioides is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
